N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4227.5 - Child care construction loan guarantees

State Regulations
A proposed project shall be eligible for assistance from the
corporation in the form of a child care construction loan guarantee, provided
that: (a) Eligible project. The
proposed project constitutes an eligible project. (b) Eligible recipient. The applicant for
assistance from the corporation shall be an eligible recipient. (c) Eligible costs. The loan guaranteed by
the child care construction loan guarantee must be made by a private sector
lending institution and shall be used only for the design, construction, improvement or renovation of a child day care center. (d) Construction and permanent financing. The
loan guaranteed by the construction loan guarantee may be used for either
construction or permanent financing of eligible costs of an eligible
project. (e) Ineligible costs. The
loan guaranteed by the child care construction loan guarantee may not be used
to finance any expense incurred prior to the initiation of the application
process for assistance from the corporation under the program. For an otherwise
eligible project, however, such expenses may be taken into consideration in
determining total project costs. (f) Levels of funding. The maximum amount of assistance from the corporation in the
form of a child care construction loan guarantee shall not exceed the
following: (1)
eighty percent of total
project costs, in the case of eligible projects located in highly distressed
communities; (2)
sixty-five percent
of total project costs, in the case of eligible projects located in
economically distressed areas; and
(3)
fifty percent of total project costs, in
the case of eligible projects that are located in areas that are neither highly
distressed nor economically distressed areas. Notes
